summary: Maybe I'm just confused but why forbid Joxter from interacting with Snufkin? Esp since he was an orphan and all, if Joxter...
question: Maybe I'm just confused but why forbid Joxter from interacting with Snufkin? Esp since he was an orphan and all, if Joxter redeemed himself I doubt Snufkin really would believe it. It seems rather cruel to me, Too-ticky forbidding Joxter interacting with his son.
answer:
Too ticky isn’t necessarily… a good guy? But she’s not a bad guy either. Eternals, by nature are neutral and sort of just morally grey and ambivalent, not necessarily preventing bad things but also making sure shit doesn’t go TOO wrong. despite being pretty high up on the power scale, she can’t really fuck with too much and her species has a pretty direct moral code when it comes to killing (she cannot kill or be killed). basically she tries to keep people in check. she saw an intense potential in snufkin, being the son of both a fae spirit and a demon, and immediately understood that if his father alone raised him to adolescence, he would most likely end up steering him to do what he thought his species was meant to do, and train yet another powerful demon in moominvalley. she didn’t want that, and decided on a (hopefully temporary) solution; joxter could keep an eye on snufkin and help “raise” him without too directly interfering with him, and this would ALSO hopefully give joxter the push he needed to actually redeem himself.

also, she kinda just does whatever she thinks will work best. she’s like, alright, sure. let’s do it.

she was kind of unhappy when joxter went HAM when she first was like hey, my son now, but she figured it would be better in the long run than having two high level demons running about

summary: Interesting fact: the Moomins are always happy to invite their friends in for a winter hibernation, but one winter Mymble and...
caption: Interesting fact: the Moomins are always happy to invite their friends in for a winter hibernation, but one winter Mymble and Little My have to sleep in a cardboard box in a cave. Idk what happend, but it was certainly My’s fault.

blog.name: thefearisoneself
blog.title: You know. Me, Chad of Camelot.
blog.description: Hello! Please call me Jir! While I reblog lots of things my art is all under my Moominvalley tag, please check it out! I'm a 21 year old girl with High functioning Autism from Canada. My current biggest fandom is Moomins with my favourite character being Snufkin. I am also a fan of Wander over Yonder, Star vs the Forces of Evil, Steven Universe, Ducktales, Undertale, Gravity Falls, the Adventure Zone, OK KO and We Bare Bears. If you have any questions or just want to tell me something, go right ahead, don't be afraid to ask! Just please nothing rude.

summary: The Sniff Show (aka Moomin) episode 5 reactions
title: The Sniff Show (aka Moomin) episode 5 reactions
body:
- BA BABA BA BA BABA BA BA!!!

- “The Secrets of the Hattifatteners” is such a great title. When does the eldritch horror start?

- M.Papa sending Moomin out into the storm to check the tent rope.

- All hail the pole. All hail the pole.

- Mr. Hemulen is a thief

- Ah yes, the death orchid

- Just go check the boat!

- Moomin actively entering dangerous situations seems to drive this show forward

- Sniff would have made sure the boat was tied up in the first place

- The barometer is honestly much more important to the plot than I had figured it would be.

- Again, Moomin just willingly enters into dangerous situations

- Where did the H.F.s even get the barometer in the first place?

- There’s no light source. How can they even see anything?

- Snork-Maiden just turned into Daphne from Scooby-Doo

- You have magic ointment? Where are such items acquired in this land?

- There are 10 minutes left in this show. Are they all going to be about S-Maiden’s hair?

- That’s a lot of vape smoke

- The rats are the first to flee a sinking ship

- Congrats everyone, you just ejected an indigenous people from their homeland

- IT’S WHIMSY TIME!

- Scan the beach for trash. Watch out for used needles.

- Stop going into strange caves, Moomin!

- Oh god it’s a corpse!

- Form a religion around the figurehead

- This music. Is Moomin in love with the figurehead?

- HE IS! Moomin is an otaku confirmed.

- Push Hemulen back in

- Snufkin is at his limit with Hemulen’s BS

- There’s gold here. Good thing the H.F.s aren’t around to claim it anymore. Colonialism wins again.

- Better get the gold to Sniff so he can invest it properly.

- M.Papa is a fool. No charts or maps. 

-Sniff made no appearance. Worst episode yet.

summary: Both Pokémon and Moomins try to improve the quality of the lives of their consumers and help them be healthier.
body:
Both Pokémon and Moomins try to improve the quality of the lives of their consumers and help them be healthier.

Change my mind. I dare you.

This was prompted by the knowledge of Pokémon Go being made to get us go outside and Pokémon Sleep (in production) to help us sleep better and feel better about waking up in the morning. On top of this their Designs are very soft and adorable, which also makes us feel better just by looking at them.

Moomins, also, share this soft and happiness prompting design, they also showcase a lot of cute things, eye opening things, and the franchise has several games that exist so the children could learn things while there also exists a wide variety of recipes that are healthy and tasty.
